intro: Galium rumelicum, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender stems that are often hairy and bear small, opposite leaves with a slightly heart-shaped base. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Galium rumelicum is often found in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
